## evaluateBaseColorProperty() function

Allows to easy parse/encode technique's base color property value as number coded color.

Function takes care about property parsing, interpolation and encoding if neccessary.

 ColorUtils

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function evaluateBaseColorProperty(technique: Technique, env: Env): number | undefined;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  technique | [Technique](./harp-datasource-protocol.technique.md) | the technique where we search for base (transparency) color value |
|  env | [Env](./harp-datasource-protocol.env.md) | \[\[Env\]\] instance used to evaluate \[\[Expr\]\] based properties of \[\[Technique\]\] |

<b>Returns:</b>

number \| undefined

\[\[number\]\] encoded color value (in custom \#TTRRGGBB) format or `undefined` if base color property is not defined in the technique passed.
